item.title: Google patches first Chrome zero-day exploited in attacks this year
item.description: Google has released emergency updates to fix a high-severity Chrome vulnerability exploited in zero-day attacks, marking the first such security flaw patched since the start of the year. [...]

item.title: Microsoft confirms 8.8-rated security issue in Windows 11 Notepad due to modernization efforts, Patch Tuesday fix rolling out
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed a Remote Code Execution vulnerability (CVE-2026-20841) in Windows 11’s modern Notepad app. The flaw allows attackers to exploit malicious Markdown links to execute code in the user’s security context.

item.title: Notepad++ boosts update security with ‘double-lock’ mechanism
item.description: Notepad++ has adopted a "double-lock" design for its update mechanism to address recently exploited security gaps that resulted in a supply-chain compromise. [...]

item.title: Lecornu en équilibre entre soutien aux solutions de la DINUM et recours à la French tech
item.description: Le Premier ministre a publié une circulaire « relative à la commande publique numérique » couchant noir sur blanc la doctrine de l’État concernant les choix et achats de logiciels par ses services. Elle priorise l’utilisation de solutions internes existantes avant l’achat de produits « sur étagère ». Le développement de solutions en interne n’arrive qu’après. Depuis […]

item.title: Microsoft Teams outage affects users in United States, Europe
item.description: ​Microsoft is working to resolve an ongoing outage affecting Microsoft Teams users, causing delays and preventing some from accessing the service. [...]

item.title: Passwords to passkeys: Staying ISO 27001 compliant in a passwordless era
item.description: Password-based authentication is increasingly risky as organizations adopt passkeys to strengthen security and meet ISO/IEC 27001 requirements. Passwork explains how to align passwordless adoption with Annex A controls, risk assessments, and secure implementation practices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says Windows 11 update causes BSOD on some GPU config, broke WPA3 Wi‑Fi, but a fix is rolling out
item.description: Microsoft says it is aware of two separate issues that could affect some Windows 11 installs, including a fatal bug that crashes PCs.

item.title: Microsoft pushes back “switch to MacBook” for a compact adapter, says Surface has slim chargers too in a viral X post
item.description: A viral post comparing a MacBook charger to an old Windows brick sparked backlash, but the comparison ignored how most modern Windows laptops already use compact USB-C adapters.

item.title: Windows 11 may finally let you move and resize the taskbar in 2026 as Microsoft responds to user feedback
item.description: Microsoft is reportedly preparing to restore one of the most requested features in Windows 11 the ability to move the taskbar to the top or sides of the screen. Alongside this change, the company is also working on taskbar resizing. The update is expected as part of Microsoft’s broader 2026 improvements.

item.title: Microsoft begins pushing Microsoft 365 Copilot on macOS if you use fresh installs of Microsoft 365 suite enterprise
item.description: Microsoft is moving ahead with its plans to push Microsoft 365 Copilot to more customers on macOS, mostly enterprises.

item.title: Former Bing boss says Windows 11 killed the vertical taskbar for symmetric UX, says it was the best productivity feature
item.description: Former Bing boss says Microsoft cut Windows 11’s vertical taskbar for its “symmetric panes” design, calling it the best productivity feature.

item.title: Microsoft réserve Windows 11 version 26H1 aux machines Arm sorties cette année
item.description: Microsoft a précisé mardi le plan de déploiement de Windows 11 version 26H1. Contrairement aux mises à jour annuelles classiques programmées sur le deuxième semestre de l’année, cette version attendue au printemps se destine à un périmètre matériel limité : celui des machines équipées de processeurs Arm sorties en 2026, à commencer par le Snapdragon […]

item.title: Opera Project Web Rewind : retrouvez l'Internet d'il y a 30 ans !
item.description: Opera célèbre son trentième anniversaire en offrant une véritable machine à remonter le temps numérique : le projet « Web Rewind » propose une plongée interactive et nostalgique dans l'histoire d'Internet.

item.title: What 5 Million Apps Revealed About Secrets in JavaScript
item.description: Leaked API keys are nothing new, but the scale of the problem in front-end code has been largely a mystery - until now. Intruder's research team built a new secrets detection method and scanned 5 million applications specifically looking for secrets hidden in JavaScript bundles. Here's what we learned. [...]

item.title: New Keenadu backdoor found in Android firmware, Google Play apps
item.description: A newly discovered and sophisticated Android malware called Keenadu has been found embedded in firmware from multiple device brands, enabling it to compromise all installed applications and gain unrestricted control over infected devices. [...]

item.title: L'alarmante connexion entre cryptomonnaies et trafic humain explose en 2025
item.description: Loin des fantasmes du dark web, les réseaux d'exploitation humaine opèrent désormais au grand jour sur des messageries populaires, utilisant les actifs numériques pour orchestrer leurs crimes à l'échelle mondiale.

item.title: L'immortalité numérique : le projet déroutant de Meta pour les défunts !
item.description: Et si votre profil Instagram pouvait continuer à poster des photos et à commenter celles de vos amis, même après votre disparition ? C'est la perspective troublante ouverte par un nouveau brevet déposé par le géant de la technologie.

item.title: Poland arrests suspect linked to Phobos ransomware operation
item.description: Polish police have detained a 47-year-old man suspected of ties to the Phobos ransomware group and seized computers and mobile phones containing stolen credentials, credit card numbers, and server access data. [...]

item.title: Ireland now also investigating X over Grok-made sexual images
item.description: Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC), the country's data protection authority, has opened a formal investigation into X over the use of the platform's Grok artificial intelligence tool to generate non-consensual sexual images of real people, including children. [...]

item.title: Washington Hotel in Japan discloses ransomware infection incident
item.description: The Washington Hotel brand in Japan has announced that that its servers were compromised in a ransomware attack, exposing various business data. [...]

item.title: Eurail says stolen traveler data now up for sale on dark web
item.description: Eurail B.V., the operator that provides access to 250,000 kilometers of European railways, confirmed that data stolen in a breach earlier this year is being offered for sale on the dark web. [...]

item.title: Man arrested for demanding reward after accidental police data leak
item.description: Dutch authorities arrested a 40-year-old man after he downloaded confidential documents that had been mistakenly shared by the police and refused to delete them unless he received "something in return." [...]

item.title: Infostealer malware found stealing OpenClaw secrets for first time
item.description: With the massive adoption of the OpenClaw agentic AI assistant, information-stealing malware has been spotted stealing files associated with the framework that contain API keys, authentication tokens, and other secrets. [...]

item.title: CISA gives feds 3 days to patch actively exploited BeyondTrust flaw
item.description: CISA ordered U.S. government agencies on Friday to secure their BeyondTrust Remote Support instances against an actively exploited vulnerability within three days. [...]

item.title: Canada Goose investigating as hackers leak 600K customer records
item.description: ShinyHunters, a well-known data extortion group, claims to have stolen more than 600,000 Canada Goose customer records containing personal and payment-related data. Canada Goose told BleepingComputer the dataset appears to relate to past customer transactions and that it has not found evidence of a breach of its own systems. [...]

item.title: New ClickFix attack abuses nslookup to retrieve PowerShell payload via DNS
item.description: Threat actors are now abusing DNS queries as part of ClickFix social engineering attacks to deliver malware, making this the first known use of DNS as a channel in these campaigns. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5077181 fixes gaming bugs, Nvidia black screen, and performance issue affecting explorer.exe, taskbar, and Start menu
item.description: KB5077181 could make some PCs faster if explorer.exe was hanging on your system, and it also fixes the black screen issue on Nvidia GPUs.

item.title: How to check if Windows 11 has applied the new Secure Boot 2023 certificates (replaces Secure Boot 2011)
item.description: Windows 11’s February 2026 update begins replacing aging 2011 Secure Boot certificates with the newer Windows UEFI CA 2023, which is triggering TPM-WMI Event Viewer logs like Event ID 1801, that look alarming but are actually part of a staged rollout designed to avoid failures to firmware.

item.title: Exclusive: First look at Lenovo ThinkPad X13 Detachable, the “thinner” ThinkPad makes a comeback after two years
item.description: Our exclusive leak gives you a first look at what could be the Lenovo ThinkPad X13 Detachable. Expected to launch at MWC.

item.title: Tested: Windows 11 can now pick up your Spotify session from Android, similar to Apple Handoff for iOS
item.description: Windows 11 Resume feature is now integrating Spotify for cross-device playback functionality to transfer the music playback session from your Android phone to your Windows 11 PC.

item.title: Ingérences numériques étrangères : VIGINUM doté de « moyens renforcés »
item.description: VIGINUM annonce pouvoir collecter les données issues des petites plateformes où sont souvent pensées les opérations de manipulations contre la France, relève l’AFP. Un décret, présenté hier en Conseil des ministres et publié ce 12 février au Journal officiel, dote en effet le service de vigilance et de protection contre les ingérences numériques étrangères de […]
